clinical_study.brief_title: Acceptability/Feasibility of HIV Testing by ELISA or Rapid Test to Adult Patients in Paris, France
clinical_study.official_title: Acceptability and Feasibility of HIV Testing by ELISA or Rapid Test to Adult Patients Consulting Their General Practitioner in Paris, France: A Multi-center Prospective Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: CDC recommends universal HIV testing in all adults, at least once during life, to reduce the pool of infected patients unaware of their status. Routine universal HIV testing can use "classical" ELISA tests from serum, or rapid tests, ideally from finger-stick whole blood (FSB), which have shown close predictive values from classical tests. The investigators will compare the acceptability and feasibility of the two methods.

detailed_description.textblock: The multi-center prospective randomized study will compare the acceptability and feasibility of routine universal HIV testing to adult patients consulting their general practitioner in Paris, France, using either the " classical " ELISA tests from serum or rapid tests from FSB (Insti®).

primary_outcome.description: answer by "yes" or "no" to the single following question: "do you agree to perform an HIV test?"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after HIV testing proposal
secondary_outcome.description: Number of HIV test results recovered within a month upon enrollment

arm_group.description: Patients enrolled in this arm will be tested by usual HIV Elisa
Patients enrolled in this arm will be tested by the new rapid HIV test

intervention.description: HIV testing randomized between ELISA or rapid test
HIV testing randomized between ELISA or rapid test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients consulting their general practitioner in Paris, France
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients previously known as HIV-positive,
- patients who declare having been tested HIV-negative less than three months ago,
- patients who can not give informed consent
